wikipedia_page.main: Charles William Slingsby "Sim" Duncombe, 3rd Earl of Feversham DSO (2 November 1906 – 4 September 1963), styled the Hon. Charles Duncombe until 1915 and then Viscount Helmsley until he succeeded his father in 1916, was a British Conservative politician.

response: * Lady Anne Dorothy Wood,  (31 July 1910 – 25 March 1995); married Charles Duncombe, 3rd Earl of Feversham, on 14 December 1936.
Lady Alexandra had affairs with Jock Whitney, Michael Lubbock, Walter Monckton, and Charles Duncombe, 3rd Earl of Feversham.
*Charles Duncombe, 3rd Earl of Feversham, who also became a Conservative politician.

link_mentions.page: Charles William Slingsby Duncombe, 3rd Earl of Feversham

response: *Charles Duncombe, 3rd Earl of Feversham (1906–1963), English Conservative MP; son of 2nd Earl; Viscount Helmsley 1915–1916

It was chaired by Charles Duncombe, 3rd Earl of Feversham and the meetings were held privately. The committee requested oral and written testimony from 100 organizations and individuals in Great Britain and worldwide. The responses they received were predominantly religious, with some medical and very little legal representation.
